alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Lee (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 27 at 7:05PM EDT until July 27 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, Jackson, Lee and Owsley. * WHEN...Until 1015 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 705 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... McKee, Booneville, Green Hall, Mummie, Elian, New Zion, Wild Dog, Privett, Earnestville, Travellers Rest, Sturgeon, Nathanton, Turkey Foot, Herd, Vincent, Banford, Delvinta, Arvel, Gray Hawk and Endee.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
